column5: With renos galore around here, the flu and just general business, I didnt get out this fall too much. (that will change)  But I did manage to get my moose hunt in with a group of guys I have known since kindergarten.  (and yes they did invite me lol)  The camp is well organized and there is rarely a year where they arent successful  Theres enough guys in on the TAG that usually and adult tag is available.  The camps been there in various forms since the late 40's I think, and I've been in and out of there with my bud for a long time.  All the Uncles and cousins nephews and family friends usually make it in, for the week long hunt.  My buddy runs things for the most part now (3rd generation) and set me up with a bunk and a watch tower for the week.  Cell service is just about non existent most of the time, so it was kinda nice to take a break and just ... well watch.   The food was amazing as always and the evening conversations.. always piled high .. lol  My buds two daughters are quite into the hunt and are responsible for skinning out and then on the last day everyone gets together and the moose is cut and packaged right at camp.  Heres a few pictures, enjoy.  The Watches
MMMM moose meat I use to get some every year till my grandfather died. Congrats on filling that tag. No more voice over singing in commercials though.
Nice hunt TJ. Jesh, whoda thunk it. drinking at the huntin camp..... But Jello shooters..... seriously???? LOL  Cheers, Ron...
Ya ... we were celebrating my buds 50th.. or otherwise known as "the demise of his youth...."
Well done boys !!!!! Feels great knowing there is gonna be some moose meat in the freezer for the winter !!!!! Nice hunt camp too !!! Wow ... Looks like a 5 star resort !!!! Lol ...
That picture with the two girls skinning the moose is awesome! Really impressive if you ask me.  Looks like a great crew/camp/hunt/time! Who wouldn't want to do that?
Good times! Congrats on a successful hunt!!  S.

Nothing is more Canadian than moose steaks on the BBQ in the middle of February, snowbanks keeping the bevies from freezing. the smell of 2 stroke exhaust and ice build up frozen to your moostache...Congrates on the hunt!  smoke some with that maple syrup of yours and send me a ham for ruining my ear drums
